title.rendered: How Kidney Stone Surgeon In Uttam Nagar Can Give You The Perfect Treatment

content.rendered:
Considered as a serious issue, surgery of stone becomes a must with the kidney stone surgeon in Uttam Nagar. With a dedicated diet, almost 95% of the kidney stone cases do not need surgery and will pass through automatically. The size of the majority of stones is almost 5mm in measurement. Without remedial service, these sizes can go. Surgery is needed, when you have the stones measuring around 10mm or larger than half an inch. The size of the stones can increase as large as golf balls. It can destroy the function of the kidney since bigger stones remain in the kidney for a longer period of time.

Procedures Prior To Surgery

To check every condition of the body is alright, patients need to undergo several tests and procedures. There are certain tests like calcium loading tests, blood screens, kidney diagnosis, analysis of stone and collection of the 24-hour urine sample. Doing these tests and collecting the samples will prove that whether you have a kidney stone or not.

# How The Operation Is Done

* Open Surgery

The Stone Surgeon in Uttam Nagar needs to make a slit at the side or in the abdomen of a patient for the removal of the stone. For the removal of stone, the doctor opens up the part of the kidney To drain the urine until the kidney heals, the doctor places a catheter or small tube near the kidney. The open is done very rarely.

* Ureteroscopy Procedure

You need to undergo the ureteroscopy if the stone is stuck in the ureter. With the assistance of ureteroscope which is placed in the urethra, the surgeon tries to take out the stones. This telescope-like instrument is placed near the bladder, where the stone is struck. For the removal of the stone, the surgeon places another instrument or use the laser to break up the stone. Under the general anesthesia, this procedure is being carried out

* Percutaneous nephrolithotomy

Used for the removal of larger stones, a percutaneous nephrolithotomy procedure is used. Using a telescopic instrument called nephroscope, the surgeon does the operation. Through and into the kidney, the surgeon makes an incision. Using a laser, the doctor is either broken or pulled out from the kidney. Under the general anesthesia, this surgery is done. You need to be in complete rest for nearly 48 hours after the surgery is over. For stones which are being 21- 30 mm in diameter, this surgery is effective

* Conclusion:-

With so many good procedures, you can safely come to the “
